pull_request.title: Add gravity, magnetic field API's to World class

update.description:
[SDFormat pull request 247](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/247/move-gravity-and-magnetic_field-tags-from/diff) moved the `gravity` and `magnetic_field` tags from the `<physics>` block to the `<world>` block. This requires changes in the gazebo code for accessing the gravity data.

Since the `PhysicsEngine` instances currently expect `<gravity>` to be in their sdf code and want to read and write to it, I've added API's to the `World` class to allow reading and writing the gravity sdf element in the new location:

* `ignition::math::Vector3d World::Gravity() const`
* `void World::SetGravitySDF(const ignition::math::Vector3d)`

The `PhysicsEngine::SetGravity` API is still needed so that each physics engine can overload it. For convenience, I've also added `void World::SetGravity(const ignition::math::Vector3d)`, which just calls `PhysicsEngine::SetGravity`.

Sorry for the late submission, but this is a critical bug fix. If this is not merged, then we will need to revert [sdformat pull request 247](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/247).

This requires sdformat to be built from default, as the current prerelease doesn't have PR 247 merged yet.
update.title: Add gravity, magnetic field API's to World class

content.raw:
I believe they are both covered by `UNIT_PhysicsEngine_TEST` indirectly through `PhysicsEngine::[GS]etParam`, since I got some test failures over the weekend that I had to fix. There were over 100 tests failing when gravity wasn't working properly, but they are passing now.

I'll work on a more explicit test, though, on principle. Is it ok if it's included with the upcoming deprecation pull request so we don't further delay the sdformat release?
content.html:
I believe they are both covered by UNIT_PhysicsEngine_TEST indirectly through PhysicsEngine::[GS]etParam, since I got some test failures over the weekend that I had to fix. There were over 100 tests failing when gravity wasn't working properly, but they are passing now.

I'll work on a more explicit test, though, on principle. Is it ok if it's included with the upcoming deprecation pull request so we don't further delay the sdformat release?

Since the `PhysicsEngine` instances currently expect `<gravity>` to be in their sdf code and want to read and write to it, I've added API's to the `World` class to allow reading and writing the gravity sdf element in the new location:

content.raw: I have already deprecated this in another branch (a0178f3), but I would prefer that the `World::*` API's be used, so I wouldn't add `PhysicsEngine::Gravity`. It's easier to get a `WorldPtr` than a `PhysicsEnginePtr`, so I think it shouldn't be a burden
content.html: I have already deprecated this in another branch (a0178f3), but I would prefer that the World::* API's be used, so I wouldn't add PhysicsEngine::Gravity. It's easier to get a WorldPtr than a PhysicsEnginePtr, so I think it shouldn't be a burden

pull_request.title: Add gravity, magnetic field API's to World class

pullrequest.title: Add gravity, magnetic field API's to World class

content.raw:
I've only added new API's to `World` in this pull request. I am planning to deprecate `PhysicsEngine::GetGravity` and `PhysicsEngine::MagneticField` in favor of the `World::` API's, but I'm saving that for a later pull request, but it's not too small (a0178f3).

So for new API's I thought we didn't have to touch Migration.md, just for deprecations and removals?
content.html:
I've only added new API's to World in this pull request. I am planning to deprecate PhysicsEngine::GetGravity and PhysicsEngine::MagneticField in favor of the World:: API's, but I'm saving that for a later pull request, but it's not too small (a0178f3).

So for new API's I thought we didn't have to touch Migration.md, just for deprecations and removals?

content.raw: I believe the `magnetic_field` logic was there for backwards compatibility since the element was added to sdf 1.5 after its first release. I'll simplify the `MagneticField` function instead, since the logic isn't necessary.
content.html: I believe the magnetic_field logic was there for backwards compatibility since the element was added to sdf 1.5 after its first release. I'll simplify the MagneticField function instead, since the logic isn't necessary.
